name: Baked Falafel with Dill and Parsley

ingredients.notes: soaked with one teaspoon baking soda 12–24 hours, then drained

instructions: Soak dried chickpeas in plenty of water for 12–24 hours with a teaspoon of baking soda. Drain and rinse well before using.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly oil or spray it.
In a food processor, combine soaked chickpeas, onion, garlic, dill, parsley, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, black pepper, salt, and cayenne. Pulse until coarse but holds together—do not purée.
Transfer mixture to a bowl. Stir in baking powder and flour. Start with 1 1/2 tbsp flour and add more if needed to bind the mixture.
Optional: Chill mixture for 20–30 minutes to help it firm up.
Form mixture into small balls or patties (about 1 tbsp each) and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
Lightly brush or spray the tops with oil. Bake for 22–25 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown and slightly crisp.
